content.question: As indicated by the passage, Vietnam’s achievement of independence differed in what way from the achievement of independence by many other former colonies?

choices.label: Vietnam gained its independence through a violent uprising rather than a negotiated settlement.
Vietnam was seeking to gain its independence from a non-European country.
Vietnam achieved its independence in a much shorter time than most other former colonies.
Vietnam’s independence movement relied on support from a narrow segment of the population.

content.answer: Vietnam gained its independence through a violent uprising rather than a negotiated settlement.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
